9cfd5c98-907c-4051-8715-ebb2720e04ef.description: The Service Learning Digital Badge system is a system which intends to allow students, staff, and all related faculty a method of evaluating and highlighting student-involvement in several fields, specialties, and activity areas. The Service Learning Digital Badge aims to serve as an incentive and challenge to encourage students to partake and dedicate their time to both entertaining and informative activities and pursuits.
9cfd5c98-907c-4051-8715-ebb2720e04ef.name: College of Natural and Health Sciences Service Learning Digital Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in either Community Service, Campus-Related Events or Course and/or College and Program Related Activities.
Students are evaluated and rewarded in accordance to the number of hours they contribute and dedicate from their time totaling from all mentioned categories and more.

21930d46-ddaa-4623-953d-ad9da1216e04.description: The PAL plays an important role in the academic development of their peers, supporting students who might be daunted by some obstacles they face. Peer interaction, peer support and role modeling are all components of the PALs support. PALs model good academic and interpersonal behavior, and demonstrate leadership skills by assisting or administering internal/external events organised by the university or external organisations/companies.
21930d46-ddaa-4623-953d-ad9da1216e04.name: ZU Peer Assistance Leader (PAL)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintain  a cumulative TGPA of 3.0 or greater. Remain in good academic and judicial standing. Enroll at university for at least two semesters.

Serve as  a Peer Assistance Leader for a  minimum of one year. Spend a minimum of 2- 4 hours per week supporting other students with their academic development. Assist with various  internal and/or external events.
Demonstrate good oral and written communication skills. Demonstrate dedication, responsibility, confidence, and adaptibility. Score pass rate of 70% in COPE (mid semester evaluation) /Appraisal.

0d29217c-6c7d-4553-8501-1983f99e4585.description: Participants fully engaged with students from across the Middle East and the United States. They discussed and exchanged cultural differences between the two areas of the world. They became more confident at public speaking and more able to point their point of view across. This program also increased overall confidence about their own abilities. They also became more accepting of cultural differences.
0d29217c-6c7d-4553-8501-1983f99e4585.name: Global Connect

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Global Connect Program.

80169e8e-b9a7-409c-a8d8-c453d76bb120.description: The PALs Mentor plays an important role in the academic development of their peers, supporting students in their academic studies. Peer interaction, peer support and role modeling are all components of the PAL Mentor's support. Mentors model good academic and interpersonal behavior and demonstrate leadership skills by assisting or administering internal/external events organized by the university or external companies.
80169e8e-b9a7-409c-a8d8-c453d76bb120.name: ZU PAL Mentor

badge_template_activities.title: Maintain cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater. Remain in good academic and judicial standing. Enroll at university for at least three semesters.

Serve as a Peer Assistance Leader for  a minimum of one year. Spend a minimum of 2- 4 hours per week supporting other students with their academic development. Assist with new PALs  applicants selection process . Observe individual PALs daily work to ensure they abide by the PALS Program rules and regulations. Assist with various  internal and/or external events.
Demonstrate good oral and written communication skills. Demonstrate dedication, responsibility, confidence, and adaptibility. Score pass rate of 80% in COPE (mid semester evaluation) /Appraisal.

c89db33b-288a-4065-b400-2f964c214cd7.description: The earner of this badge is able to select a specific research topic and write a thesis statement. The earner can formulate relevant question(s) and hypothesis to address the topic. The earner can write a brief introduction about the selected topic. The earner is able to develop a conceptual framework, which shows the relationships between the different variables of the study. Finally, the earner can present a preliminary outline of the research project.
c89db33b-288a-4065-b400-2f964c214cd7.name: Research Star Scholar Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Completing module 1 of the URSP program
Select a research topic, formulating a research question and hypothesis
Writing an Introduction (one- two pages)
Present a preliminary outline of the research project

ef7e9371-2845-4a0c-a5f1-520768d1dce3.description: The 2018 Special Olympics was an extremely important social and cultural event in the UAE. The Bronze Badge was awarded to volunteers who demonstrated a desire to actively support worthwhile causes, people skills, time management skills, team spirit and compassion. Silver Badge holders were able to work independently but also effectively follow instructions. They were members of a small team of volunteers assigned to specific roles and duties.
ef7e9371-2845-4a0c-a5f1-520768d1dce3.name: Special Olympics Bronze Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Must have completed 40 hours of volunteering and completed the GVT training

7531189f-916b-47ed-a8ae-0dee2b891f61.description: A series of 5, 60 minute workshops where students learn the basics of Excel such as the interface, tabs and ribbons, entering, editing and formatting data, formatting numbers, managing worksheets, modifying rows and columns, creating and formatting charts, understanding formulas, using operations, using Excel Functions like Average, Median, Mode, Max, Min, Count, Sum, Percentiles, Quartiles, Standard Deviation, Variance, Conditional Logic: IF Statements
7531189f-916b-47ed-a8ae-0dee2b891f61.name: University College, Excel Training

badge_template_activities.title: Students need to attend all 5 sessions and complete a 75 word reflection which should be checked and signed off by the workshop leader.

49f0f2e8-3889-4c90-8d80-c4356b80b3db.description: The student demonstrated long-term commitment to volunteer work and community service within or outside Zayed University in a project related to the academic programs of the College of Humanities and Social Science.
49f0f2e8-3889-4c90-8d80-c4356b80b3db.name: CHSS Digital Badge in Volunteering and Community Service - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Students can apply after performing 20 hours of approved CHSS-related volunteer work within or outside ZU. They are required to upload evidence that show achievements and its quality. Evidences includes certificate of volunteering, conference, photographs, videos, reports, presentation, media coverage, etc. Students must engage in voluntary work or community service to a high standard, as judged by a ZU faculty member or by an external organization.

a9269bfb-4f41-4c9d-893f-2cf75326fc27.description: The earner of the College of Education’s Outstanding Students Research and Creative Projects Symposium Award is awarded to students in the College of Education who display and present outstanding work during the College of Education’s Research and Creative Projects Symposium on both campuses. Two undergraduate student awards and two graduate student awards will be made each semester, one for each campus.
a9269bfb-4f41-4c9d-893f-2cf75326fc27.name: Outstanding Symposium

badge_template_activities.title: A panel of judges will be formed, and the following project evaluation criteria will be used to determine the winners of this award, if any: Range and Depth of Content; Use of Evidence; Originality; Criticality; Presentation of Information; Language use

a2b3d366-7412-4679-a25b-f93d21d5f17b.description: The PALs Manager plays an important role in the academic development of their peers. Peer interaction, peer support and role modeling are all components of the PAL Manager’s support. Managers have excellent interpersonal behavior and demonstrate outstanding leadership skills in supporting the Program and university events. They assist the Program Coordinator in strategic and operational decisions and have regular meetings to discuss strategic planning and how to implement tasks/activities.
a2b3d366-7412-4679-a25b-f93d21d5f17b.name: ZU PAL Manager

badge_template_activities.title: Maintain cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater. Remain in good academic and judicial standing. Enroll at university for at least four semesters.

Serve as a Peer Assistance Leader for a minimum of one year. Spend a minimum of 2- 4 hours per week supporting other students with their academic development.  Assist with new PALs applicants selection process.   Manage and coordinate  PALs duties and activities. Assist with various  internal and/or external events.
Demonstrate good oral and written communication skills. Demonstrate dedication, responsibility, confidence, and adaptibility. Score pass rate of 90% in end of semester Appraisal.

46106d1e-f266-44ee-bc9c-40418a72e97d.description: The earner can write a comprehensive literature review about his/her research topic. The earner can develop a full research proposal. The earner is able to identify ethical concerns related to the study and apply for research ethics review.
46106d1e-f266-44ee-bc9c-40418a72e97d.name: Research Star Scholar Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Completing module 2 & 3 of the URSP program
Write a comprehensive literature review (3-4 pages)
Finalize the research proposal
Obtain ethical clearance from the Research Ethics Committee at Zayed University

06adc8b7-d495-4a12-b5ad-35903a729536.description: The badge earner has demonstrated her/his ability to simultaneously organize significant numbers of students. The badge earner has clearly demonstrated her/his ability to work as a member of an effective team. The badge earner fully understands the need to have all relevant documentation completed and archived where necessary
06adc8b7-d495-4a12-b5ad-35903a729536.name: ZU Expo Logistics Coordinator

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has made a volunteer commitment of over 30 hours. S/he has also reflected on her/his experience and has submitted the reflection as a text. S/he has also received written confirmation that the hours required for this badge were completed and to a satisfactory standard.

7df84136-5baa-4f0c-937c-ec33263772ca.description: The student represented Zayed University, and the College of Humanities and Social Sciences, or themselves with distinction in a public speaking or debating forum related to the academic programs of the College within or outside Zayed University.
7df84136-5baa-4f0c-937c-ec33263772ca.name: CHSS Digital Badge in Public Speaking or Debating - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Students can apply to earn one credit towards a digital badge on successful completion of a public speaking or debating activity. . Students must speak, present, or debate to a high standard, as judged by a ZU faculty member or external partner who observes the activity. Students need to upload evidences that shows their achievement and its quality. This can include: letter of commendation, certificate of volunteering, conference, photographs, videos, reports, presentation, media coverage, etc.

67f478fb-711a-4691-a950-535cb637e22e.description: Participants conducted up to 60 hours of voluntary on-line academic support for middle school and high school children. They kept their tutees learning and engaged with their studies. They interacted with the children’s families and acted as a form of support for the whole family. Participants provided support for 2-3 different children, often from different families. They used their own academic/professional skills to support others
67f478fb-711a-4691-a950-535cb637e22e.name: Covid-19 Service

badge_template_activities.title: The badge is given to volunteers who provided on-line support to children of medical workers away from home fighting Covid-19.

8181d9be-ad52-429e-a205-0e531aae7f0e.description: The earner can write a full academic research report. The earner can present research findings in conferences. The earner is able to identify an academic journal and go through manuscript submission process.
8181d9be-ad52-429e-a205-0e531aae7f0e.name: Research Star Scholar Golden

badge_template_activities.title: Completing module 4 & 5 of the URSP program
Generate a full academic research report
Submit a manuscript to a peer reviewed journal
Present in international/ national conferences

e818e06b-6b99-4827-9469-74f5dca2890c.description: The badge earner has demonstrated the ability to proactively assist faculty and students with agreed arrangements. S/he has demonstrated the ability to keep confidentiality when there are logistical reasons for students being delayed. S/he has demonstrated the ability to work close with, and support faculty.Organized, monitor others , decision making, accountability, communicative, reliable, punctual, attention to detail, approachable, able to keep confidentiality, shows initiative
e818e06b-6b99-4827-9469-74f5dca2890c.name: ZU Logistics Leader

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has made a volunteer commitment of between 10 and 20 hours. S/he has also reflected on her/his experience and has submitted the reflection as a text. S/he has also received written confirmation that the hours required for this badge were completed and to a satisfactory standard.

0d74d13d-dee9-40f6-b3d2-99994f992b6b.description: The earner of the College of Education’s Outstanding Teacher Candidate Award is: • an actively enrolled internship student in the College of Education • displays excellence in their final semester’s Teaching Internship based on the EDC490 portfolio. Note: Two awards will be made on each campus each semester.
0d74d13d-dee9-40f6-b3d2-99994f992b6b.name: Future Teacher Award

badge_template_activities.title: 8 post-lesson reflections, one for each teaching week; 3 (three) formal mentor teacher lesson observation forms; 2 (two) formal university supervisor lesson observation forms; Mentor Teacher Final Evaluation form; University Supervisor Final Evaluation form; Teacher Candidate Final Self-evaluation form

49af44e5-dd77-455e-bddf-a5a3e6902018.description: The badge earner has demonstrated her/his ability to organize students into groups of students and assign appropriate supervision to the group, and assign correct transport. S/he demonstrates a strong logistical capability. S/he is able to compile all required documentation and ensure its safety. S/he has shown she is able to analyze specific situations and take appropriate action.
49af44e5-dd77-455e-bddf-a5a3e6902018.name: ZU Logistics Officer

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has made a volunteer commitment of between 18-29 hours. S/he has also reflected on her/his experience and has submitted the reflection as a text. S/he has also received written confirmation that the hours required for this badge were completed and to a satisfactory standard.

05b53484-1096-4bab-b90b-409813818d14.description: This badge recognizes students who present their work in the Student Research and Creative Projects Symposium organized by the College of Education each semester.
05b53484-1096-4bab-b90b-409813818d14.name: COE Symposium Participant

badge_template_activities.title: The purpose of the badge is to: • publicly recognize and celebrate Zayed University students’ • encourage course-related research and creative project achievements, and to • motivate students to raise the standard of their future academic-related work.

1775788d-90b6-47de-a334-3ab7453261b6.description: This is a public event so official ZU Graduation Volunteers have been carefully selected. S/he is able to work independently as well as able to follow instructions. S/he is able to communicate effectively and positively. Takes personal responsibility for work assigned, able to supervise others. S/he has a high degree of decision-making responsibility. S/he meets their commitments 100%. S/he communicates in a timely and effectively manner
1775788d-90b6-47de-a334-3ab7453261b6.name: ZU Official Graduation Volunteer

badge_template_activities.title: Graduation volunteers must be highly reliable and have successfully worked as volunteers on previous opportunities.

skills.name: Committed; Organized; leadership; able to supervise; decision making; Accountability; communicative; reliable; punctual; attention to detail; approachable; able to keep confidentiality; shows initiative Polite;

5492ebd7-0b27-43b4-9c1c-664622c2d3d7.description: This student volunteer badge is issued by the College of Education at Zayed University and is for students who have volunteered for events associated with the College of Education. This badge recognizes the voluntary activities undertaken by College of Education students outside of their college course work.
5492ebd7-0b27-43b4-9c1c-664622c2d3d7.name: College of Education Student Volunteer Badge

badge_template_activities.title:
The badge is offered for events associated with the College of Education, and includes the following types of voluntary activities:
Activities internal to COE_ZU: for example, volunteering to assist at the College of Education Annual Conference or at ZU Majors’ Day
Activities external to, but associated with, COE_ZU: for example, Dubai Cares Walk and school engagement projects unrelated to the students’ program of study

997d7bd3-13d9-4d38-993e-9b0741a858e9.description: This badge is awarded to students who have gone above and beyond, successfully completing an additional 5 hours of Community Service on top of the 5 hours required for the mandatory Life Skills course (COL 120), as evidenced by their site supervisor’s testimonial and the student’s reflective writing on their experience. Students who earn this badge have valuable work experience and a commitment to helping their community.
997d7bd3-13d9-4d38-993e-9b0741a858e9.name: University College Community Service Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass Life Skills course (COL 120) and required group work
Complete 5 hours of community service per course requirement, plus at least 5 additional hours of community service to qualify for the University College Community Service Badge

Each group completes an oral presentation, including visual aids, about their research findings and their experience competing the community service. Submit APA reference list and use APA in-text citations.

Each group submits a portfolio which contains documentation of the project from start to finish including the team charter, presentation, references, copies of information sources, evidence of service, etc.
Each student must complete a written self-evaluation and reflection about their own performance working on the project and in their group, and their experience completing the community service.

9ba52d04-7302-4e87-8529-44fc2f3f539c.description: Participants conducted up to 40 hours of voluntary on-line academic support for middle school and high school children. They kept their tutees learning and engaged with their studies. They interacted with the children’s families and acted as a form of support for the whole family. Participants provided support for 2-3 different children, often from different families.
9ba52d04-7302-4e87-8529-44fc2f3f539c.name: Covid-19 Service

badge_template_activities.title: The badge is given to volunteers who provided on-line support to children of medical workers away from home fighting Covid-19.

5da32ce1-0833-4b34-aa7e-3b24f0e6fd70.description: This badge recognizes the voluntary literacy-related activities associated with the College of Education and undertaken by Zayed University students outside of their college course work. The badge is offered for voluntary participation in literacy events in Arabic or English associated with the College of Education, and includes the following types of voluntary literacy-related activities:
5da32ce1-0833-4b34-aa7e-3b24f0e6fd70.name: College of Education Literacy Event Volunteer Badge

badge_template_activities.title:
Participation in College of Education ‘Month of Reading’ activities at Zayed University in March
Participation in the COE booth at the annual Abu Dhabi Book Fair
Non-course related read aloud sessions on the Promenade/Atrium

48e8e1ab-9e71-4b44-a80e-8d14f240a4e2.description: The Career Development Initiator (Level 1) is awarded to ZU students who are active in their own career development by participating in programs, activities and opportunities. Recipients of the award will able to demonstrate awareness and skills acquired through counselling, self awareness, reflection and CV development
48e8e1ab-9e71-4b44-a80e-8d14f240a4e2.name: Career Development Initiator -Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Must be UC/Major Student, GPA 2.0 and above
Complete the on-line career/personality assessment
one-to-one career advising session
Profile on ZU Career Portal
Curriculum Vitae

3dccc5fb-fbe6-461a-997e-97df25746ba1.description: This badge recognizes those individual students who volunteer to assist in the College of Education’s Early Childhood Learning Centre in a given semester.
3dccc5fb-fbe6-461a-997e-97df25746ba1.name: College of Education ECLC Volunteer

badge_template_activities.title: The badge is awarded to students who engage in a voluntary capacity in ECLC activities that are not related to their coursework. This includes sssisting in ECLC classrooms or common areas for 32 hours or participating in at least two special events in the ECLC.  Voluntary activities in the ECLC include: creating displays or materials related to curriculum and program activities.

0e2f1d4c-d0c3-4eac-8bc3-b2b1597fa484.description: The Career Development - Innovator Level 3 is awarded to ZU students who are active in their own career development by participating in programs, activities and opportunities. Recipients of the award must be able to demonstrate employability skills and awareness acquired through experiential learning opportunities and participation in EDDAD Program
0e2f1d4c-d0c3-4eac-8bc3-b2b1597fa484.name: Career Development Innovator Level 3

badge_template_activities.title: Pre-requisite - attained Level 1 & 2
EDDAD Internship preparartion Program
Upload CV to Career Portal
3 career related workshops/activities
Complete 8 week internship

65863e10-3668-49ca-b766-ca911ad1e1da.description: The earner will complete a porfolio of evidence to support the content area., and will show excellnece in carrying out their assigned tasks.
65863e10-3668-49ca-b766-ca911ad1e1da.name: Future School Social Worker

badge_template_activities.title: 8 (eight) detailed interventions plans, each with a reflection, one for each week in internship; 3 (three) formal mentor SSW observation forms; 2 (two) formal university supervisor observation forms; Mentor SSW Final Evaluation form; University Supervisor Final Evaluation form; SSW Candidate Final Self-evaluation form

10746484-1f48-4c4f-bce7-26e993655827.description: Student can take reponsibility for an activity, and talk to event attendees with confidence and reliability, one to one tutoring, accommodate material, note taking, guide students around campus.
10746484-1f48-4c4f-bce7-26e993655827.name: SAS Student Volunteer

badge_template_activities.title: 18 hours voluntary work at awareness  events or volunteer for 20 hours general activities.

816cebad-0987-46b2-b56e-4008d0b6b8e5.description: Earners of this training badge have demonstrated competence in comprehending basic anxiety and stress management psychological knowledge Earners have developed basic skills in practicing and applying stress- and anxiety-reduction self-management techniques Earners are able to engage in personal self-development activities.
816cebad-0987-46b2-b56e-4008d0b6b8e5.name: SCC Anxiety & Stress Management Training Badge

badge_template_activities.title: ZU certificate confirming s/he attended 3 workshops on anxiety & stress self-management strategies  S/he completed 4.5 hours of personal development training with ZU Student Counseling Centre 75 word reflection on the attended training

skills.name: Emotional Intelligence; Mindfulness Skills; Stress Management Skills; Anxiety Management Skills; Self-assessment & Evaluation; Self-reflection; Experiential Learning; Active Learning; Social Skills; Collaborative Learning; Group Participation;

81801dbc-0b76-4de6-a86e-39e0fa1fc11f.description: The 2018 Special Olympics was an extremely important social and cultural event in the UAE. The Gold Badge was awarded to volunteers who actively demonstrated excellent organization skills, people skills, and had exemplary time management skills. Gold Badge holders assumed responsibility and oversaw a large number of volunteers who were working in diverse roles. The Gold Badge holders interacted with the general public as well as representing the university to the Games organizers.
81801dbc-0b76-4de6-a86e-39e0fa1fc11f.name: Special Olympics Gold Badge

badge_template_activities.title: completed 100 hours of volunteering, taken a senior volunteer role, completed the GVT training

c43e21b7-4ea2-404c-bfd9-bb7f65d3c584.description: The Career Development Champion badge is awarded to ZU students who are active in their own career development by participating in programs, activities and opportunities. Recipients of the award must be able to demonstrate skills acquired through experiential learning opportunities both on and off campus.
c43e21b7-4ea2-404c-bfd9-bb7f65d3c584.name: Career Development - Champion

badge_template_activities.title: Provide appropriate evidence.

490403e8-7aa0-46a8-9330-74e8b46a2997.description: Career Development - Implementer Level 2 badge is awarded to ZU students who are active in their own career development by participating in programs, activities and opportunities. Recipients of the award must be able to demonstrate skills acquired through experiential learning opportunities either on and off campus
490403e8-7aa0-46a8-9330-74e8b46a2997.name: Career Development - Implementer Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Pre-requisite - attained Level 1
Minimum 30 hours of part-time/volunteering experience
CV
3 career workshops and activities

1a8229ec-110e-47a8-adf2-bc23b0aa2aea.description: This badge recognizes those individual students who assume a leadership role in activities associated with the College of Education. The badge is awarded to students who assume a leadership role in COE activities, including the following:
1a8229ec-110e-47a8-adf2-bc23b0aa2aea.name: College of Education Student Leadership Badge

badge_template_activities.title:
Leading one-off special events associated with the College of Education, such as organizing the Dubai Cares walk
President of a College of Education sponsored club, such as the Education Club or the Social Club

53961c48-1954-45f9-b529-3758fdac260c.description: The earner of this badge has illustrated basic understanding of project management principles, process groups, and knowledge areas, specifically scope, time, and cost. S/he was able to produce a project management plan showing the integration of key outputs.
53961c48-1954-45f9-b529-3758fdac260c.name: Projects

badge_template_activities.title: Produce a project management plan with three major omponents: Management Summary (project charter), Management and Organization (key personnel and authority relationships, manpower, training and development), and Technical Section (project activities, timing, and cost)

34652499-3663-4f6d-8274-8c8fbef74db2.description: Faculty and staff provide support for Students of Determination by giving individual academic support, facilitate workshops, organize activities for awareness events, invigilate exams.
34652499-3663-4f6d-8274-8c8fbef74db2.name: SAS Faculty/Staff Volunteer Badge

badge_template_activities.title: 20 hours volunteering for SAS which has been approved by the managers and director.

84342635-5232-44fc-895e-1fdcee38074f.description: Students can provide individual tuition, accommodate material, take notes for students in class, assist with guidance of students with a physical disability, facilitate workshops for students, organize awareness events.
84342635-5232-44fc-895e-1fdcee38074f.name: SAS Student Leadership Volunteer Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Must have received SAS Student Volunteer Badge and volunteered for 4 different awareness events

04f1fd2d-18e6-46cd-8852-950a406a7c95.description: The badge highlights skills used and developed from events hosted by the University College English and Writing Studies (EWS) department. The EWS department hosts student-centered events that aim to enhance students experience and develop real-life skills. Students need to attend two out of two events (Writing Techniques 1-Online workshop & Panel Discussion with invited Emirati Authors) and reflect on their experience in each event and the skills that were used or developed to receive a badge.
04f1fd2d-18e6-46cd-8852-950a406a7c95.name: Short Story and Poetry Writing Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Critical drafting techniques: Students will be introduced to drafting and storytelling techniques and challenged to use one technique to write a poem or story with a universal audience in mind. Rethinking - students will be asked to reconsider their drafts and use their critical thinking skills to be aware of a global audience (world book month) and different ways of narration and description. Students also will gain experience in contributing to an online workshop talking about their ideas.

Celebrating World Book Day & March Month of Reading: In recognition of World Book Day & Month, students in ENG 140 &145 will utilize their learning in the competition to come up with initiatives to promote story telling through poetry and story writing. They will be asked to share their ideas with other students in English courses. The research competition is designed to acknowledge the best student writers for Spring 2021 and promote  poetry and storytelling among students.

skills.name: Knowledge About Writing Short Stories And Poetry

ba32df98-cd0a-4e48-a098-bb57f43c3997.description: The badge highlights skills used/developed from events hosted by Department of Science, Mathematics, and Technology (SMT) and Department of Interdisciplinary Studies (IDS) in the UC. The SMT and IDS departments host student-centered events that aim to enhance students experience and develop real-life skills. Students will need to attend four out of the five available events and reflect on their experience in each event and the skills that were used/developed to receive a badge.
ba32df98-cd0a-4e48-a098-bb57f43c3997.name: University College, General Skills Badge

badge_template_activities.title: There will be five (5) events that students can attend. Each event is 1-2 hours in length and is open to both male and female students.  1. Innovation Techniques 2. Frame Breaking versus Minor Change 3.  Happiness Day Event 4. Research Poster Competition 5. SMarT Gym

5fe3aac4-bfcc-4b08-9205-d845e964f4c0.description: The badge earner has demonstrated the ability to work supportively with students of determination. S/he has demonstrated her ability to communicate effectively with students who have a diverse range of disabilities. S/he has demonstrated a high degree of flexibility and sensitivity. Organized, has a high degree of sensitivity , decision making, communicative, attention to detail, approachable, able to keep confidentiality, shows initiative.
5fe3aac4-bfcc-4b08-9205-d845e964f4c0.name: ZU Accessibility Logistician

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has made a volunteer commitment of over 20 hours. S/he has also reflected on her/his experience and has submitted the reflection as a text. S/he has also received written confirmation that the hours required for this badge were completed and to a satisfactory standard.

e3f0fdd1-7e39-45fe-a803-02a3854e99bb.description: The SAP Dual Study program exposes students to the latest SAP technologies and enables universities to integrate SAP software into their teaching. The earner is able to develop management skills, enhance technical aptitude, foster leadership qualities to produce better leaders for tomorrow, and acquire experience and training that enables them for a future with SAP, their clients, and their partners.
e3f0fdd1-7e39-45fe-a803-02a3854e99bb.name: ZU SAP Program

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a Cognitive Exam set by SAP and provide documentation of achievement.
Attend required SAP Dual Study Program training sessions (40 hours)
